org.cpsolver.ifs.criteria

Class AbstractCriterion<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cpsolver.ifs.criteria.AbstractCriterion<V,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Variable
    T - Value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanHoldContext, HasAssignmentContext<V,T,AbstractCriterion.ValueContext>, Criterion<V,T>, ExtendedInfoProvider<V,T>, InfoProvider<V,T>, ModelListener<V,T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AssignedValue, ExamCriterion, InstructorSchedulingCriterion, TimetablingCriterion

    public abstract class AbstractCriterion<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>
extends Object
implements Criterion<V,T>, HasAssignmentContext<V,T,AbstractCriterion.ValueContext>, CanHoldContext
    Abstract Criterion.

    An optimization objective can be split into several (optimization) criteria and modeled as a weighted sum of these. This makes the implementation of a particular problem more versatile as it allows for an easier modification of the optimization objective.
    This class implements most of the Criterion except of the Criterion.getValue(Assignment, Value, Set).
    Version:
    IFS 1.3 (Iterative Forward Search)
    Copyright (C) 2006 - 2014 Tomáš Müller
    muller@unitime.org
    http://muller.unitime.org

    This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

    You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License along with this library; if not see http://www.gnu.org/licenses/.
    Author:
    Tomáš Müller

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractCriterion.ValueContext
      Assignment context holding current value and the cached bounds.
      protected static class  AbstractCriterion.ValueUpdateType
      Defines how the overall value of the criterion should be automatically updated (using Criterion.getValue(Value, Set)).

      • getContext

        public AbstractCriterion.ValueContext getContext(Assignment<V,T> assignment)
        Returns an assignment context associated with this criterion. If there is no assignment context associated with this criterion yet, one is created using the HasAssignmentContext.createAssignmentContext(Assignment) method. From that time on, this context is kept with the assignment and automatically updated by calling the AssignmentConstraintContext.assigned(Assignment, Value) and AssignmentConstraintContext.unassigned(Assignment, Value) whenever a variable is changed as given by the AbstractCriterion.ValueUpdateType.
        Specified by:
        getContext in interface HasAssignmentContext<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>,AbstractCriterion.ValueContext>
        Parameters:
        assignment - given assignment
        Returns:
        assignment context associated with this constraint and the given assignment

      • createAssignmentContext

        public AbstractCriterion.ValueContext createAssignmentContext(Assignment<V,T> assignment)
        Description copied from interface: HasAssignmentContext
        Create a new assignment context for the given assignment. If there are already some variables assigned in the value, the method should make sure that the context is appropriately initialized.
        Specified by:
        createAssignmentContext in interface HasAssignmentContext<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>,AbstractCriterion.ValueContext>
        Parameters:
        assignment - an assignment for which there needs to be an assignment context
        Returns:
        a new instance of the assignment context, filled according to the given assignment

      • getAbbreviation

        public String getAbbreviation()
        Abbreviated name of the criterion for Object.toString().
        Returns:
        abbreviated name of the criterion

      • toString

        public String toString(Assignment<V,T> assignment)
        Simple text representation of the criterion and its value. E.g., X:x where X is the getAbbreviation() and x is the current value getValue(Assignment).
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Criterion<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>
        Parameters:
        assignment - current assignment
        Returns:
        short string representation (e.g., PP:95% for period preference)
